proposals.reasoning: Including myself (Diana) guarantees at least one good player from my perspective. Bob has broad early trust and wants cross-checking rather than blind following, which is generally pro-good behavior. Henry is a quieter player many have independently suggested, which gives us information on someone not already central to the discussion while avoiding stacking both Alice and Charlie—one of whom I know may be deceptive. This lineup balances influence, avoids concentrating power in the loudest early voices, and keeps both of the potentially high-risk special reads (Alice/Charlie) off the very first mission while still giving us a strong info baseline from the result.

votes.comment: None of my known-evil players are on it, and it’s a solid, low-risk first mission for gathering info.
Team aligns with many independent suggestions, includes me for direct info, and avoids concentrating early loud voices; nothing overtly suspicious yet for Mission 1.
Solid mix of talked-about players plus a quieter one, and it avoids concentrating too much early influence in the same small group while giving us good info from the result.
I know I’m good, and this lineup avoids the Alice/Charlie Merlin/Morgana risk while giving us early info on Bob and Henry without over-concentrating influence on the loudest voices.

Good early compromise that avoids the originally over-favored trio, includes at least one self-claimed trusted slot (Diana) plus a quieter player (Henry) for info. First mission is low info anyway; better to get a result than stall.
This matches the Bob–Diana–Henry mix I already supported and gives useful early info without over-concentrating influence on the loudest players.
This matches the mix I argued for (Bob–Diana–Henry); it avoids the too-quick Bob–Charlie–Diana consensus while giving us good early info on a quieter player without stacking the loudest voices.
I’m on the team and there’s at least one evil included, so it’s a good setup for us to gain info and potential sabotage later.
This matches the lineup I advocated (Bob–Diana–Henry) and gives us early info with a mixed loud/quiet team without stacking the most central voices.

discussion.content: Since it’s the first mission, I’d rather start with a safer-looking mix of people who’ve been pretty reasonable so far—something like Bob, Diana, and maybe Grace—so we can get some early info without stacking it with the most aggressive voices yet.

I’m okay being on the team, but I’d rather swap at least one of Diana or Grace for someone like Charlie so we’re not just rubber‑stamping Alice’s whole suggestion without any cross-check. Early on, spreading trust a bit and avoiding one person steering everything usually gives us better info.

I like the idea of mixing perspectives too—something like Bob, Diana, and me spreads things out a bit without giving any one person too much control this early. If we keep Grace off the first team, we also get a cleaner comparison later if she pushes hard for or against it.

I’m fine with a Bob–Charlie–me lineup for the first mission: it spreads influence a bit and gives us some early voting and mission-result info without stacking it too heavily in any one person’s favor. If this passes and goes clean, we’ll have a decent starting core to compare future teams against.

I’m a little wary of how quickly everyone converged on Bob–Charlie–Diana, so I’d like at least one name change—maybe swap in Grace or Henry—just so we’re not handing the first mission entirely to the loudest early voices. Early diversity in lineups gives us way better info later.

I actually don’t mind Bob–Charlie–Diana as a starting point, but I’d also be fine with something like Bob–Diana–Henry so we’re not locking in the same voices everyone’s already gravitating toward. Getting at least one quieter player on the first mission will give us better comparison data later.

I don’t love how fast Bob–Charlie–Diana became the default; I’d rather see a mix like Bob, Diana, and Henry so we’re testing at least one of the quieter players instead of just reinforcing the early talkers. If that’s too big a change, I’d at least like one swap so the first team isn’t entirely shaped by the same small group.

I’d lean toward Bob–Diana–Henry for the first mission so we’re not just locking in the same cluster everyone snapped to, but still keep two of the more central voices for comparison. If that feels too self‑serving with me on it, I’d be okay with swapping me for Grace and keeping the same general idea of mixing loud and quiet players.

I’m a bit uneasy with how neatly things narrowed to Bob–Charlie–Diana, so I’d rather see Bob–Diana–Henry or Bob–Diana–Grace to mix loud and quieter players while still keeping only one of Charlie/Grace on the first mission. That way, if the mission passes or fails, we get clearer info instead of lumping too many central voices together right away.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 already has a confirmed spy among Bob, Diana, and Henry, so the cleanest next step is to exclude that entire trio to avoid repeating known risk. A lineup of Alice, Charlie, Grace, and Iris matches what multiple players (including me) have converged on as the most informative and least tainted group: it introduces two completely fresh players (Grace, Iris) while only using people who were not on the failed mission. If this team succeeds, suspicion stays focused on the original trio; if it fails, we immediately know at least one spy lies among Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris and can then re-evaluate those who pushed this lineup. This makes it both strategically safe for Good and highly informative for future missions.

votes.comment: I don’t like putting both me and Charlie together on a key 4‑person mission this early; if it fails we learn very little about which of us is the problem. I’d rather swap Charlie for someone from the original trio to better isolate where the spy is.

I know I’m good, so the fail on Mission 1 means Diana or Henry (or both) are likely evil. This team avoids all three of us from the first mission, so it’s a clean test and a reasonable low‑risk choice.
I like keeping the original trio off while still getting good info; I’m comfortable going on this team.

I know I’m good, so the spy on Mission 1 must be Bob or Henry (or both). Excluding that entire trio and using a widely supported fresh team of Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris is our cleanest, most informative option right now.
Best informational and safety value: fully avoids the failed trio (Bob, Diana, Henry) and everyone has converged on this as the cleanest test lineup.
Happy with a team that keeps suspicion on the original trio while still including Charlie to give us sabotage potential and good cover.
Best way to avoid the suspicious original trio entirely and get strong information; if this fails, we narrow evil to this new group immediately.
Consistent with my earlier support for excluding the original failed trio; this lineup keeps suspicion focused there while still allowing useful information from the result.
Team fully avoids the suspicious first mission trio and matches the informative lineup I advocated; best way to localize the spy cluster.

discussion.content: Given the fail on the first mission, I think we should avoid stacking too many of Bob, Diana, and Henry on the same team again. I’d like to see more from people who haven’t gone yet—Grace and Iris seem like good additions to consider.

We know there’s at least one spy between Diana and Henry from that first mission, so for this one I’d really like a team like me, Grace, Iris, and one of Alice/Charlie/Frank instead of reusing that pair.

I like the idea of bringing in fresh faces, but since the first fail had Bob on it too, I’d rather see a team like Alice, Grace, Iris, and me this round. That lets us avoid both Diana and Henry completely while still testing some new people.

I agree we should completely avoid reusing that first team core—between Bob and Henry there’s at least one spy, and I know I’m good—so a group like Alice, Charlie, Grace, and Iris feels like the safest, most informative lineup right now.

I’m definitely on board with avoiding the whole first team core for now, so Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris sounds like a solid, low‑risk pick to me. I’d especially like to see Grace and Iris on this one so we get more info on people who haven’t gone yet.

I’m fine with completely dodging the first-team core for now, so something like Alice/Grace/Iris plus either Charlie or me feels best—fresh info without doubling down on the same suspects. Between Bob and Henry there’s clearly at least one problem, so I’d rather keep both off this mission.

I’m very happy with a team like Alice/Charlie/Iris/me this round—keeping all of Bob, Diana, and Henry off feels like the cleanest way to isolate that first fail. If that lineup still fails, we’ll know the problem isn’t just in the original trio and can start questioning the people pushing it hardest.

Avoiding the whole first team makes sense given the early fail, so I’m fine with something like Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris for now. If that lineup still fails, we’ll have to start re‑evaluating some of the people who are pushing it as “safe.”

I’m very happy to go on this mission, and I strongly prefer a team of Alice/Charlie/Grace/me that completely avoids the original trio for now. If that group still gets a fail, we’ll have a much clearer idea that the problem isn’t just in Bob/Diana/Henry.

proposals.reasoning: This lineup keeps the team mostly on players who haven’t been paired together on a failed mission while avoiding the most heavily suspected combos. It uses me (Frank) as new blood, plus Eve who wasn’t on either failed mission, and Grace and Iris who many players have expressed conditional trust in, provided Charlie, Diana, and Henry sit out. This matches the consensus direction from the table to avoid stacking suspects from the previous missions and to leave Charlie, Diana, and Henry off this round for a cleaner information read.

votes.comment: I don’t like a 4-person team with zero overlap to Mission 1; if this fails we get almost no comparative info. I’d prefer at least one of Bob/Diana/Henry on instead of running a totally fresh block built around mostly untested players.

As a known good to myself, I’d rather be on this critical team, and this lineup still double-dips from the second failed mission (Grace/Iris) while completely excluding me, so it feels too risky at 0–2.
One known evil (Frank) is on the team while I’m off, giving us a strong chance to secure the third fail without raising extra suspicion.
Team has both Grace and Iris from the failed Mission 2 block where we know there’s at least one evil; most table logic was to include at most one of them, so this feels too risky at 0–2 down.

Both Grace and Iris were on the failed Mission 2, where there is at least one evil among Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris. Putting both Grace and Iris back on together risks repeating the same hidden saboteur(s); I’d prefer a team with only one of them plus me and more fresh blood like Bob/Frank.
I’m on the team, so I can ensure this mission fails and secure the third evil point.

This matches the structure I pushed for earlier: me plus Frank, Eve as fresh, and Iris instead of Charlie/Diana/Henry. I know I’m good, Charlie feels worse than Iris, and this avoids the most suspicious combos while giving us a realistic shot at a clean team.
This matches the ‘clean’ mix I suggested earlier—Frank as new blood plus Grace and Iris, with the main suspects (Charlie, Diana, me) all off the team for a clearer read.

Matches the ‘Frank + me + Grace + Eve/Bob’ structure I advocated; only one player (Grace) from the suspicious Alice/Charlie/Grace set and none from the Diana/Henry pair, giving a relatively clean test with minimal reuse of known-contaminated combos.

discussion.content: Given both missions have failed with completely different lineups, I’d like to avoid stacking too many people who’ve already been on failed teams, and I’m especially wary of Charlie after that last mission. I’d be comfortable seeing Grace and Iris on the next team, paired with a couple of others who haven’t been together on a failed mission yet.

I know there’s at least one evil between Diana and Henry from the first mission and at least one among Alice/Charlie/Grace/Iris from the second, so for this team I’d like to see more “fresh blood” like Frank and Eve and avoid stacking too many from either failed lineup, especially Charlie.

If we assume each failed mission only had one saboteur, I’d rather see a mixed team like Frank, Eve, Grace, and Henry so we’re not stacking too many people from the same failed lineup, and I’m fine staying off if folks are wary of me.

Given both fails had totally different cores, I’d like a team like Frank, Grace, Iris, and Henry/Bob so we’re mixing “fresh blood” with just one person from each failed mission instead of stacking the same combos.

From my perspective we should completely avoid repeating Charlie and probably limit it to at most one from each failed mission, so I’d like to see something like Frank, me, Bob, and either Grace or Iris. I’m especially wary of Henry and Diana together after Mission 1, and I don’t want us stacking too many from either failed lineup.

Given both fails, I really don’t want to stack people from the same bad missions, so I’d prefer a lineup like me, Eve, Grace, and Iris, with Charlie, Henry, and Diana all sitting this one out. That keeps us mostly on “fresh” or at least less–contaminated combos while we sort out who’s actually causing the fails.

From my side I know there’s at least one evil among Alice/Charlie/Iris, and Charlie feels the shadiest after that last mission, so I’d like a team built around Frank, Eve/Bob, and just one of Alice or Iris plus me. I really don’t want to see Charlie, Diana, and Henry all back on so soon given both fails.

Given both fails and how much heat is on Diana, Charlie, and me, I’d rather see a “cleaner” mix like Frank, Grace, Iris, and either Eve or Bob this round. I’m fine sitting out so we’re not repeating too many from the failed teams and can get a clearer signal.

From my seat I know there’s at least one evil among Alice/Charlie/Grace, and Charlie feels the worst to me after that last mission, so I’d really like to see a team like Frank, me, Grace, and Eve/Bob, with Charlie and the Diana–Henry pair staying off this round.
